comments.body:
There are lots of datatypes to support. I noticed that the date/datetime/timestamp related fields don't have a formats representation. Should we add those?

Are all the provided formats under test?

There are! I noticed a new preview datatype `BIGNUMERIC` as well.

I can definitely add the date/time stuff, I think I avoided this because people tend to prefer 3rd-party libs for this? E.g. Joda time.

But yes, all the formats should be covered by the [end-to-end test](https://github.com/armanbilge/alpakka/blob/wip-new-bigquery/google-cloud-bigquery/src/test/scala/akka/stream/alpakka/googlecloud/bigquery/e2e/A.scala).
Decided to add these! They are covered by the E2E test.
I just added support+tests for the `BYTES` type via Akka's `ByteString`. So that covers about everything, besides the `GEOGRAPHY` type.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@ * Provides all the predefined JsonFormats for the BigQuery REST API.
 */
trait BigQueryRestJsonProtocol
    extends BigQueryRestBasicFormats
    with StandardFormats
